poem:
Title: Surge in Sorrow

Necks, backs
hang heavy with the weight
of unseen work.
A nation bends,
curves of spines tracing 
the trajectory of descent.

Sedentary, we age,
our bodies—
hostages to the machinery 
of modern progress.

Their cries—
a million strong—
unheard over the methodical 
typing, clicking, scrolling.

In our comfort,
we cultivate discomfort,
our spirits derailing
on tracks of bone and sinew.
